name: Pacific Beach Hotel

reviews.title: Loved it!!
reviews.text: Stayed @ pacific beach Hotel for 5 nights and it was FABULOUS! I think you have to have an OceanFront room to make this hotel worthwhile.

reviews.title: Pacific Beach Hotel
reviews.text: Definitely staying here again.

reviews.title: Once again - a very good bargain
reviews.text: We were on the 11th floor and woke up to the beautiful waters. Couldn't hear any noise the whole week. Elevators had it's good times and bad.

reviews.title: WOW
reviews.text: Moderately spacious Lanai and room. Nice vanity area with big mirrors. Empty fridge to store water. Free coffee w/coffeemaker in the room. Small bathrooms, maid service was good & friendly.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: I prefer the eastside of Kalakaua because you can walk down the street and see the beach in front of you on one side. Closer to the Outrigger and Surfrider this is not possible due to the beachfront hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I (2 adults, 2 kids 12 & 13) just returned from staying at this hotel, in the Oceanarium Tower, and thought it was great. The front desk were friendly and welcoming upon arrival, at one point I thought housekeeping were storing towels in our room we had so many, and the transport/valet parking guys downstairs were equally as friendly. You can't complain when your cab back to the airport turns up as a stretch limo (at regular taxi rates!).
reviews.title: We had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The view was spectacular, especially as we were on the 28th floor and the location was ideal for everything we wanted to do in Waikiki and Oahu in general.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to pick a negative point it would be the elevators, they were slow and extremely stomach-lurching.
reviews.title: NIce Location, Disappointing Hotel

likes.disliked: — The lack of Cleanliness was the worst!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would agree with other reviews that are already posted. I only booked this hotel for the amenities but did not use any of them. We booked a partial ocean view room the first 2 nights and then an ocean view room the rest of the time. As you can see by the photos, the views weren't any different. But, the staff did change the rate on our room when we called the front desk. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful - especially the bell men. Our room was always clean with new towels provided everyday. The room itself was very outdated. The carpet was gross and needed to be replaced. The rest of the hotel was nice and clean. The location was excellent - right in the heart of Waikiki. Lots of shopping, eating, and swimming close by. I am sure for the money this was a great hotel - I will save more money and stay somewhere nicer next time.
reviews.title: Nice View but Need Renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed in Honolulu for a week for my honeymoon, this hotel was me and my husband last stop. We had the pleasure of staying at the Hale Koa for 6 nights and 7 days, and left there to stay at The Pacific Beach for one night.
reviews.title: Fair Room -Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took our first trip to Hawaii the end of February into March of this year 2008. Decided to stay in Oahu because of all the action. Took one day trip to Maui, could not wait to get back to our Home Pacific Beach. This was a perfect place to stay. The room was an OK room, but how long are you there? The view from our deck was great. We bought the included breakfast at the oceanarium. Could not have been better. The staff was very pleasant and the valets called for our transportation when we needed it and could not have been nicer. The ABC store attached was a great place to get souveniers and needed items and the little coffee shop/pizza cafe outside the hotel was a perfect afternoon get a way. The greatest thing was the location. When you came down the elevator to go to the beach or out onto the street you just walked right out onto the street without having to go thru the main lobby. The beach was right across from the one way street. There was a beautiful Catholic church just two blocks down the street.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband bought a newspaper every morning at the front desk after breakfast and there were two ladies waiting to book any excursion you wanted. Very helpful. Sometimes I read reviews from some people who are so rude and complaining about where they stay. But the Pacific Beach claims to be a 3 star hotel not a 4 or a 5. You know that when you book the hotel. The room was always clean and comfortable. But the best thing about this hotel was the location. We could not have been in a better location. Only one block from Dukes statue, one block from the free shuttle to Hilo Hatties. We had a wonderful vacation and I left a little bit of my heart in Oahu, HI. We may go back someday. The plane trip back to Ohio is tasking,but when we go back Pacific Beach will be where we stay.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel during our stay in February 2008 and we loved it! Great location, right across the street from the beach and our hotel room was exactly as we expected it to be, but the best part was our view! We loved waking up every morning to the beautiful view and just spending time on the balcony! I would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Were we ever pleased with pacific beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW! What a great stay my husband and I just had at the Pacific Beach Hotel. The staff (even the maintainance staff) were
reviews.title: Average stay

likes.liked: — Veiw of the beach and mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: always giving us a nice "aloha" or "how are you". The front desk staff were pleasant and one little lady was in training and although she made a slight error her supervisor was right there to fix it.
reviews.title: What a dump!
What a bargain!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Beach hotel for our honeymoon in June 2004. We loved it. We had a partial oceanview room on the 8th floor. I couldn't believe what a great view it was for only being partial. The room itself was very nice and clean. For only $99 per night, you can't beat it. There website has the best deals. And the very best of all, was walking out the front door and across the street and you are on the beach. Why pay $300 for the difference of only walking a few more steps. All the staff, with the exception of the hostess at the daily breakfast buffet, was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was good, although expensive as most everything is in Hawaii. We would highly recommend staying here, especially if you are on a budget but still want to stay at one of the best hotels in Waikiki. We will definitely return to the Pacific Beach when we go back to paradise in 2006.

reviews.title: Beautiful views, great place to stay
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying for 3 days at the Pacific Beach in June and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had an oceanfront room - our room was lovely with a balcony and a view I could only describe as stunning. Breakfast was delicious and the hotel is situated so conveniently to Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants etc. We would not hesitate to recommend the oceanfront to other travellers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel on Waikiki Beach for 3 nights before sailing on a cruise with NCL.
reviews.title: Great start to our Honeymoon
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice and the staff were kind and helpful. The room was spacious and had a great view of diamondhead and parts of the beach. The restaurants were a tad pricy but this is to be expected from most hotel restaurants in Waikiki. We walked up the strip to eat dinner instead.

reviews.title: Nice, if a little old
reviews.text: There is only a street separating the hotel from the beach. A couple of dozen steps from the door and you are there.

reviews.title: Great view of Diamond Head
reviews.text: To be noted is the amazing aquarium in their main restaurant dubbed "The Oceanarium" which three stories high and 290,000 gallons. The fish in there are awesome.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: Breakfast was included with our hotel package and consisted of a huge buffet with many delicious choices. We very much enjoyed having breakfast there every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looks great from the outside, front desk doesn't look too bad either, but the rooms, well that is something different. This hotel needs a major overhall. The first room we were given the panel on the, well i dont know it if was the heating or air intake vent but that was falling off the wall. The second room we were given, well at least nothing was falling of the walls but for the price i was paying i expected a lot more. This looked a very tired and worn out place and it should be renovated or they should drop the price of the rooms.
reviews.title: Terrible
The best location!
reviews.text: We had a complimentary breakfast vouchers. Lets say you would be better off going out for breakfast, most of the food was warm to cold.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: Will not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so pleased that we selected this hotel. Not only was it opposite the beach, but the rooms was spacious, clean with balconies and a great view of waikiki!
reviews.title: Nice location-pleasant staff

likes.liked: — convenience to international marketplace/shopping all around
likes.disliked: — room was dated bed not that comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel offered everything you could want and the restaurant was great for breakfast with helpful staff, good food and variety.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Nice hotel but AWEFUL front desk
reviews.text: For the price, accomodations were as expected with no frills but location next to the beach. Its a type of hotel whose light shined bright during the 70's and is living its last breath as a quallity hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: HOWEVER, the reservation/front desk made numerous mistakes like room assignments, double-booking charge that we never did clear up with reservations. Over-all customer service at the front desk was the worst experienced and their web booking should be used in conjunction with a phone verification.

reviews.title: Great Hotel--Classy and Cost-Efficient--
reviews.text: The Pacific Beach hotel is a great value for your money. My friend and I went for a relaxing vacation, we're both in our early twenties and found that the hotel had a lack of "night life" surrounding it but was within walking distance to most dance clubs and fun bars. I had read many reviews before I booked the hotel and it's true what they say about being a great value! The staff was so friendly, the oceanarium restaurant had a great breakfast (although a little pricey so make sure you can eat $16 worth of french toast!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: At about $230 for the night, this was actually pretty cheap for a waterfront hotel room here, so I was a little concerned about what we would be getting. Imagine my surprise to find myself in a fifth floor room with glorious views of the beach and the bay beyond! It was perfect.
reviews.title: Best Hotel for the Money on Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tower we were in was a little dated, but the rooms were good-sized and well-maintained. The deck was small, but big enough to sit out on. I think the other towers are newer, but they are set farther back . At any rate, I felt really fortunate – were they to upgrade the furnishings and deck, I suspect they could easily charge two or three times what we paid.
reviews.title: One of our best vacations!!
Who could ask for anything more?
reviews.text: There was a charge for internet access (bad!) and the restaurant with the aquarium was now buffet-only, but beach towels were available for free and you could walk to the beach barefoot if you wanted to. The valets (who also handle cabs and other transportation arrangements) are wonderful and will figure out the most cost-effective (and reasonable) way to accommodate any journey you may wish to take on the island. On the other hand, the concierge barely spoke English and was utterly useless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I made reservations the property was owned by Ohana, but by the time we left for Hawaii (January) it had changed ownership. Don't know what that means for the future.
reviews.title: Pretty On The Outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel March 7-15th and really enjoyed our stay. Our rooms were cleaned up every day and I would have to say that one day I left the safe open by accident and we had over $800 in the safe and my jewlery and nothing was missing!!! I could not believe this and that would be one of the reason I would not hesitate to recommend the Pacific Beach hotel. The staff was very friendly and it was so easy to get to the beach, the ABC Store!!! and lots of local restaurants. I had read some reviews that said they had problems with the elevators and we had none. The motel did not seem to me to need any updating as other people have stated and this property was worth the price. Thank you Pacific Beach Hotel for a wonderful 20th anniversary!
reviews.title: Stoll to the beach

likes.liked: — Close proximity to the beach and shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pretty scared after reading some of the reviews. We were on the 14th floor and our room was great ,our view was awesome! No you're not saying at the Hilton or some fancy hotel but it was a nice hotel. I have spent more money and stayed at worse places. Our stay was great and would do it again in the same hotel
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Well - again we were worried about our stay here based on previous messages about this hotel. Again - we were relieved to find the hotel more than adequate for our needs. Right on Waikiki beach in the resort centre. Yes the rooms were a little tatty around the edges but they were clean and comforable. The staff were always helpful. Breakfast was complimentary - a surprise to us which we thoroughly enjoyed. The lifts were not too bad - we never waited more than 2-3 minutes for one to arrive. As for the pool - who needs a pool when you have Waikiki Beach on your doorstep? The rooms also had a safe - bonus! I would recommend this hotel to anyone - value for money.
reviews.title: On the sea front of Waikiki - more than adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (2 adults 2 kids) stayed at the Pacifica Beach for 10 days March 20 -30. I was somewhat afraid after reading the reviews here but we loved it and would stay again. We were in the Beach Tower (the tower closest to the beach) on the 10th floor with a partial ocean view. We really liked it. The view was excellent. The staff was excellent and very nice. The room was average with 2 beds. Carpet was dirty but that is to be expected with a light carpet and sandy feet. Other wise nice room with coffee maker and refrigerator. Water pressure in the shower was excellent. Water was always hot even when I was the 4th in a row to shower. Bedding, pillow, mattress were all good. Each room has a balcony so it was nice to drink coffee in the morning and watch the tourists take surfing lessons. Once you get out of the elevator, it literally is 45 seconds to the beach. The beach in front of the hotel is a nice swimming area. The area next to it is great for boogie boards since more waves. We had breakfast included with our room packagage and it is a great buffet with seating next to the HUGE aquarium which is cool. The in-room safe had a sticker indicating a $3 per day charge but we were not charged at all for 10 days of use. My only complaint is the parking is expensive--- $15 per day so $150 for the trip...almost as much as the rental car. Overall, a very nice stay and I would recommend it and I will stay here again. The front desk said that next month (April) they start a remodel. There is an ABC store right off the elevator in the beach tower and there is an ABC store on every block. This store has everything you need from snacks to alcohol to sandals and it is fairly priced....they could hose you but they don't for some reason. If you need a rental car for only a day or two, there is a Dollar Car Rental right in the lobby so convenient. Next time instead of renting a car for the whole stay and pay parking, I would only rent it as needed from the lobby since some days we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After looking at the reviews, I had some resevations about my choice in hotels. Stayed from March 22-29th and booked through orbitz. Some general observations:
reviews.title: Good Overall Experience

likes.disliked: — The pool.....now come on, who places a tiny pool in a spot with less than 2 hours of total sun per day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Great location, great stay
Excellent Service!!!!!!
reviews.text: Stayed here from June 23-July2. Location was perfect, directly across the street from the beach. Hotel employees ALL were extremely friendly, nice and accomadating of our needs. Stayed in the beach tower, great view from our room (partial ocean view). During the busy times of the day, elevators were a little slow, but on Hawaii time, no one is in a hurry-what a nice change. Great vacation, would stay there and recommend it to all. Price could not be beat.

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.text: We stayed at The Pacific Beach Hotel for 2 nights on June 24th through June 26th. We booked a standard room and we were given a room on the 3rd floor of the Tower building. Our lanai had a partial view of Waikiki Beach. The staff at this hotel were excellent. I was mentioning to my husband that we needed a fold away bed just as a hotel staff was passing by our hotel room. Before I could even call housekeeping, someone was knocking on our door with a fold away bed, extra slippers and towels....that's what you call service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004
reviews.text: The hotel room was clean and nice. I have stayed at high-end hotels and the service at The Pacific Beach surpassed some of them.
reviews.title: Good with some small reservations
good location, brilliant view, average room
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon in Oct/Nov 04. Got a good early deal on the internet for $140 per night including tax and a breakfast and got an ocean view for this price, which we were v pleased with, could sit on the balcony and watch the sun set over the sea - perfect. The location is perfect, steps from the beach. the rooms were adequate but a little dated. They were v clean and lots of fresh towels for the beach everyday. We didn't eat in the restaurant because of the smell others have mentioned, I actually think this was the japanese seafood dishes not the oceanarium!!! Overall definitely worth the money but only if you get a seaview balcony.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in October 2004 as part of our honeymoon, we booked a Deluxe Ocean view room through expedia which turned out to be a partial ocean view, the room was dirty with heavily stained carpets the bedspread smelled of mould the windows did not shut properly, the shower was a pathetic piece of cheap plastic, the bed was old and uncomfortable, the hotel lobby and restaurant had a foul fishy smell because of the oceanarium, we complained to the management who triad explain to us that deluxe ocean view meant that you had lean over the balcony and risk falling to see the sea, they offered us drink and diner vouchers!

reviews.title: Pretty Good
reviews.text: This is a Two star hotel.

reviews.title: Great location. Friendly Staff.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pacific Beach for 11 days in September 2004. The hotel was pretty much what we expected for a 3 star. Pleasant staff, a great location right by Waikiki Beach and our room was a decent size. However, the main lobby definitely had a funky fishy odor which was emitted by the aquarium in the lobby restaurant- the Oceanarium. The smell was pretty hard to ignore each time we passed through the lobby. The hotel decor is a bit retro (circa 1982), but is kept clean. The rooms themselves are more modern. All in all it was worth the price considering the location and staff service.

reviews.title: We loved this hotel!
reviews.text: My mother and I just got back from a 4-night stay at the Pacific Beach Hotel, and we just loved it. We had an Deluxe Oceanview room, and woke each morning facing Diamond Head. Gorgeous! We were in the Oceanarium Tower (rear) on the 29th floor, and you could hear some music playing in the evenings from below. I'm guessing on the beach, or perhaps something going on at the Marriott Beach Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is classed as a 4 star hotel but it didnt quite live up to this. Although in a very convenient location, right on the beach, it was somewhat old looking and a bit tired. We were originally given a room beside the lifts - we soon asked to be moved! In our new room it was quiet, clean but a bit shabby! Everything worked, shower was good but it just lacked a sparkle!
reviews.title: Convenient location

likes.disliked: — It was a bit tired looking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got upgraded to a free breakfast everyday, thankfully, as I would have been disappointed if I had to pay for it. The food wasnt great so we ate out every night. it was edible just not very tasteful or inviting.
reviews.title: Great 8 day break.

likes.liked: — quiter end of town but only 10mins walk to main area. close to beach
likes.disliked: — nice room, excellent view, good friendly staff, close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was an ok hotel, but I would opt to stay somewhere else if I ever go back.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel in March 2007. We were a bit worried about the condition of the hotel, but need not have been. We stayed in an Ocean Front room in the Ocean tower on the 11th floor. The room was clean and plenty of towels and extras left everyday. The view was great, as everybody else has said, no obstructions , to the left Diamond Head and to the right the Pink Palace and other hotels and great view of the ocean. We had breakfast included which was ok. kept ypu going till the afternoon. Plenty of shops and the international market to brouse in, We found the Huntington and Hart tattoo shop, which was very classy. We bought some excellent Tshirts for gifts. Also Kings Village nearby was fun, both for eating at the Rock Island Cafe and American Tshirt shop. We went to the Hard Rock cafe which both weren.t crowded and cheap. Weather pleasant and not to hot, beach 30 seconds across the road, We hope to go back to Wakiki next year and will stay at the Pacific Beach again.
reviews.title: Great location for Waikiki beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect -- place was awesome and the service was fantastic. Stayed on the 14th floor and had great views of beach and diamond head. DONT waste money on dinner buffet, but the breakfast buffet is well worth it.
reviews.title: PBH was great again !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel quite often for business! I can say this is the worst experience i ever had with the front desk staff! The guy misinformed me about the breakfast being included with the rate and instead of apologizing to me he started this bad attitude towards me! I called the manager and he was even worst. They had only one soap in the room! so if you needed to take a shower you have to transfer it there! They wanted 3 dollars/day plus tax to use the electronic safe inside the room!
reviews.title: The worst front desk experience I ever had. Very Bad Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I dill never recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Ick!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would definitely Not stay at Pacific Beach again!!! I carefully considered ta reviews before booking this property, and at the time I booked, the majority were positive. Unfortunately I must agree with a recent booking noting how dirty the room is. We checked in to 7th floor, beach tower today and I can't wait to check out! A hotel does not have to be 4-star for me. Just clean and comfortable will pretty much do it, unfortunately, this one was filthy! Unknown stains and spots covered the carpet. Grime, some of which was easily removed with an antibacterial wipe I had with me, was all over the coffee maker, outside the microwave, and all over the light switches. I could go on, but don't think it's necessary. All the lovely views in Waikiki are not worth the filth and finding hair all over the tub!!!
reviews.title: Would not go back

likes.liked: — Located across the street from Waikiki. Concierge very helpful.
likes.disliked: — Overall condition of the room and the hotel itself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Pacific Beach for three nights in February. My kids are 7 and 10. I was not impressed at all. Sure, it's right across the street from Waikiki, but there must be some better hotels. My first reaction upon entering the room was - EEEEEEWWWW!
reviews.title: We'd Definitely Go Back to Pacific Beach - from Washington State Travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The carpet was threadbare. The fixtures were rusty. Everything just seemed dirty and worn out. The whole place needs an upgrade. I was afraid to let the kids touch things! Charging for the use of the safe sucks too. They know you have to use it, what a rip!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: In spite of the reviews I saw on this site, I booked 7 days at the Pacific Beach Hotel in April, 2007 because of the excellent location and beach across the street. Also, the price through the hotel website was many dollars less than anything else I saw. I was prepared for rundown rooms and peeling paint, but in all honesty did not see any of this. Our partial ocean view on the 11th floor of the Beach Tower was well maintained and clean with a great view of Waikiki Beach and downtown Honolulu. We chose not to get the buffet breakfast but got the continental breakfast instead which was included in the price of the room. This ended up being a wise choice as we are not big breakfast eaters and were satisfied with a muffin and a cup of coffee. It also saved us a couple of hundred dollars over the 7 days. The pool was a disappointment, but my 7 year old daughter enjoyed swimming in the lagoon across the street for hours everyday--she (and I) loved the shelter from the waves and the safety it presented. I would definitely stay here again--it is absolutely perfect for families with children--location, location, location!!!
reviews.title: Perfect for Families
Loved being right across from the beach
reviews.text: Great service and right across from the beach. Also had a room with a great view of the ocean. Hotel restaurant has a 3 story fish aquarium where at certain times of the day you can watch divers feed the fish. Great location for site seeing and within walking distance of the markets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel over the 4th of July holiday week. We booked our stay through United Airlines Vacation.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, great deal! Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: This was our first time in Oahu, so we wanted to stay near all the popular touristy stuff. We weren't disappointed. Pacific Beach's location was fabulous- our balcony overlooked Waikiki and the entrance/exit to the hotel was literally a stone's throw away from the beach.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: At night, we kept the balcony door open to hear the oceans waves. Also, after a day touring or lounging at the beach, we would kick back on the balcony and just listen to the waves. It was super relaxing.
reviews.title: great time, and some great people

description: Located across Waikiki Beach with views of the Pacific Ocean, Waikiki City Lights, and Diamond Head landmark. The hotel’s centerpiece is the 3-story indoor Oceanarium attraction with over 70 different species of Pacific marine life. Full service hotel with 837 guestrooms, island-style family dining, flexible meeting space, 24-hour fitness center, spa, self or valet parking, business center and gift shops.
